result.execSummary:
The defendant Colt Jonathan Flynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time Credit.  Sentence to commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence the defendant is currently serving.
Court reimposes costs not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoking Huber for the duration of the jail sentence.

8:44 am case called. Defendant Colt Jonathan Flynn in court, in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding motion filed by the District Attorney to revoke Huber and Good Time Credit. Defendant does not contest the allegation that contraband was brought into the jail. Court finds the facts established. Court questions defendant regarding Good Time Credit and revocation of Huber for the balance of the sentence. Statement by DA Blader-Jail is seeking revocation of Huber for the balance of sentence and not withdrawal of Good Time Credit. Court enters an order revoking Huber for the balance of the sentence and would not revoke Good Time Credit.
Motion hearing on June 2, 2017 at 08:45 am.
to Revoke Work Release Privileges and/or Forfeiture of Good Time Credit
for substitution of Counsel

4:25 pm case called. Defendant Colt Jonathan Flynn in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and warrant recieved by counsel-no material corrections or errors. Statement by Attorney Johnson regarding witnesses to make statement to court. Attorney Johnson calls Kate Minton, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross by Attorney Blader. Attorney Johnson calls Shannon Sathre, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross by Attorney Blader. Sharon Minton, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross by Attorney Blader.  Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 1-1 year WCJ, consecutive to any sentence currently serving-254 days sentence credit. With Huber and Good Time Credit. Count 2-10 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time credit, consecutive to Count 1. Costs not previously paid re-imposed and to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court will allow the defendant to satisfy 5 months of sentence on Count 2 upon entry and successful completion of an inpatient AODA program of at least 90 days-equivalent to MSDF Program. Appeal Rights Given.
from Atty Johnson requesting adjournment - Request denied by the Court - Sentencing hearing will proceed as scheduled
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

11:49 am case called. Defendant Colt Jonathan Flynn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes statement regarding counsel. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi phone call received from Attorney Johnson's office regarding representation. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding representation of counsel made to his office. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant wishes to have SPD represent him for a new SEHR date.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:45 AM: Defendant Colt Jonathan Flynn in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty. Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today. Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Elements of offenses explained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1:  NC  Plea Ct 2: NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct No 3 DRI.   Argument by DA as to cond'l Co Jail of 150 days.  Argument by SPD for lesser cond'l Co Jail of 4 mos with no TS credit being applied.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  As to Both Count Nos 1 and 2:  S/W - 30 mos probation as to each count - concurrent to one another.  Conditions:  Ct 1 only - 4 mos WCJ.  Both COunts:  AODA and any follow thru; The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Costs including in the costs is the undercover purchase money of $720.00.   DNA sample ordered to be supplied.  No TS Credit.  No GT credit.  Period of supervision is concurrent to any existing sentence.  Sentence to begin forthwith.  Appeal Rights Given.
